definition: near/approaching/to depend on/(slang) to have an intimate relationship with sb/Taiwan pr. [pang2], [bang1], [bang4]
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: Many of the Gods have fallen into a deep slumber.
sentences.chinese: 很多神灵已经陷于了深睡傍边。

sentences.english: the secret was spread among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 奥秘在人群傍边流传开来。

sentences.english: Third, set off firecrackers and the customs temporary enduring a tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第三，放鞭炮也是我国习俗傍边经久不衰的一项传统。

sentences.english: Connect the Luer lock to the trocar port on the patient side.
sentences.chinese: 在病者傍边把针头锁接与套管针端口连接上。

sentences.english: Of all the students, Wangbing reads (the) most correctly.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的这些个学生傍边王冰读患上最准确。

sentences.english: A temporary move process very auspicious time selection is the top step.
sentences.chinese: 搬家进程傍边良辰吉时的挑选是榜首步。

sentences.english: Now, turn sideways with your racquet back.
sentences.chinese: 现在，转向傍边以你的网拍向后。

sentences.english: They are over here next to coats and accessories.
sentences.chinese: 它们在这边，在大衣和饰品傍边。

sentences.english: Muras were inexplicably told to hold the jar standing sideways.
sentences.chinese: 老穆被吩咐莫名其妙地抱着罐子站在傍边。
在我傍边，坐着两个学生。

definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
erhua variant of 旁邊|旁边[pang2 bian1]
right in the midpoint/a bull's eye/to hit the nail on the head
